thread.title: Books: New and noteworthy

title: Books: New and noteworthy
text:
'Wildflower' by Drew Barrymore (Photo: Dutton)
CONNECT 39 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE USA TODAY's Jocelyn McClurg scopes out the hottest books on sale each week.
1. Depraved Heart by Patricia Cornwell (William Morrow, fiction, on sale Oct. 27)
What it's about: Our heroine, medical examiner Kay Scarpetta, is enmeshed in a frightening case that involves her beloved niece, Lucy.
The buzz: Thirteen of Cornwell's thrillers have hit No. 1 on USA TODAY's Best-Selling Books list.
2. Home by Ellen DeGeneres (Grand Central Life & Style, non-fiction, on sale Oct. 27)
What it's about: The daytime talk-show host invites fans inside her homes in this new coffee-table book.
The buzz: A famous house-flipper, DeGeneres has an HGTV show, Ellen's Design Challenge , and a home décor line, ED.
3. Sinatra: The Chairman by James Kaplan (Doubleday, non-fiction, on sale Oct. 27)
What it's about: Arriving in time for the Sinatra Centennial, this sequel to the 2010 bio Frank: The Voice picks up in 1954.
The buzz: "Engrossing… sympathetic but unflinching," says Publishers Weekly .
4. Wildflower by Drew Barrymore (Dutton, non-fiction, on sale Oct. 27)
What it's about: A memoir by the actress, looking at her happy present-day life and more challenging times from her youth.
The buzz: Can Barrymore really be 40 and old enough to write an autobiography? Seems like yesterday she was charming us as Gertie in E.T .
5. The Early Stories of Truman Capote by Truman Capote (Random House, fiction, on sale Oct. 27)
What it's about: A collection of 14 stories Capote wrote while in his teens and early 20s, before he made a splash with Other Voices, Other Rooms .
The buzz: " Entertaining…very readable," says Kirkus Reviews .
'Home' by Ellen Degeneres (Photo: Grand Central)
